required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SPD503 (Guanfacine Hydrochloride) in ADHD Plus Oppositional Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Multi-Center, Flexible Dose Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of SPD503 (Guanfacine Hydrochloride) in Children Aged 6-12 With Symptoms of Oppositionality and a Diagnosis of Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: To assess efficacy and safety of SPD503(guanfacine hydrochloride) in subjects with ADHD and oppositional symptoms.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Oppositional Subscale of the Conners' Parent Rating Scale-Revised Long Form (CPRS-R:L) Score at Up to 8 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: The oppositional subscale of the CPRS-R:L contains 10 items designed to reflect criteria for oppositional defiance disorder (ODD). Each item is scored on a range from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true) with total scores ranging from 0 to 30. Higher scores are reflective of more severe symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Up to 8 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Clinical Global Impression-Severity of Illness (CGI-S)
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I)
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-I consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the 40-Item Conduct Problem Scale of the New York Parent's Rating Scale-School-aged (NYPRS-S) Score at Up to 8 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Each item on the NYPRS-S is scored from a range of 0 (not at all) to 3 (very much) with total scores ranging from 0 to 120. Higher scores are reflective of increased disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Parent Stress Index-Short Form (PSI/SF) Score at Up to 8 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The response to each of the 36 items on the PSI/SF is converted to a five-point scale from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree) with total scores ranging from 36 to 180. A higher score is reflective of less stress for the parents.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Overall Satisfaction on the Medication Satisfaction Survey (MSS)
secondary_outcome.description: The Medication Satisfaction Survey (MSS) consists of 11 questions each being answered with one of six responses (strongly agree, agree, somewhat agree, somewhat disagree, disagree, strongly disagree). Overall satisfaction with their child taking the study medication, Question #11, with a response of "strongly agree" or "agree".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcF Interval) at Up to 8 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pulse Rate at Up to 8 Weeks
Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at Up to 8 Weeks
Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure at Up to 8 Weeks

intervention.description: Subjects will start at 1mg tablet each morning and will subsequently be titrated (in 1 mg weekly increments) to optimal dose based upon tolerance and response to investigational product (not to exceed 4 mg/day).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects with ADHD and oppositional symptoms
- ADHD-RS>=24
- CGI >=4
- T-score of Opp subscale CPRS-R:L >=65
- Normal ECG and BP
- >= 55 lbs

facility.name: University of Rochester, School of Medicine and Dentistry
Discovery and Wellness Center for Children
Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, Inc
Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, Inc

results_reference.citation: Connor DF, Findling RL, Kollins SH, Sallee F, López FA, Lyne A, Tremblay G. Effects of guanfacine extended release on oppositional symptoms in children aged 6-12 years with attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder and oppositional symptoms: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. CNS Drugs. 2010 Sep;24(9):755-68. doi: 10.2165/11537790-000000000-00000.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 217 subjects were randomized (138 to SPD503 and 79 to placebo). However, only 214 subjects received at least one dose of study medication (136 for SPD503 and 78 for placebo). Therefore, 214 subjects constitute the safety population.

group.title: SPD503
group.description: Subjects will receive either 1, 2, 3, or 4 mg/day oral doses of SPD503 (Guanfacine hydrochloride)

group.title: SPD503
group.description: Subjects will receive either 1, 2, 3, or 4 mg/day oral doses of SPD503 (Guanfacine hydrochloride)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Oppositional Subscale of the Conners' Parent Rating Scale-Revised Long Form (CPRS-R:L) Score at Up to 8 Weeks
outcome.description: The oppositional subscale of the CPRS-R:L contains 10 items designed to reflect criteria for oppositional defiance disorder (ODD). Each item is scored on a range from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true) with total scores ranging from 0 to 30. Higher scores are reflective of more severe symptoms.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of any investigational product during this study and with a baseline and at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.

outcome.description: The Medication Satisfaction Survey (MSS) consists of 11 questions each being answered with one of six responses (strongly agree, agree, somewhat agree, somewhat disagree, disagree, strongly disagree). outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcF Interval) at Up to 8 Weeks
outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually
